Definition: Given an input title generate a list of possible genres relevant to the title. The genre of a movie is a thematic category to which the movie belongs. The words in the title sentence will determine the genre of the that particular title. The input is the string of words representing the name of the movie and output is the list of words that belong to different genres or simply output is the list of possible genres. Keep in mind the following things while generating the answers: 1) The output is a list of aplhabetic words and it should not contain any numbers or speical characters. 2) The output list should contain atleast 1 item. 3) The words in the output list are most likely to be NOUNS and NOT ADJECTIVES or VERBS.

Positive Examples.explanation: The input title contains the word "hate" which is related human emotion and feelings therefore one of the possible genre in the output is "romance". The pharse "10 things i hate" sometimes relate the movie to the "comedy" genre. Thus, other genre is "comedy".

The input title has the word "space" which tells us that one of the genre can be "sci-fi" because the word "space" in related to science fiction. The word "odyssey" means journey or voyage so "adventure" is also the genre of input movie title and thus appears in the output. The term "2001" relates to the YEAR 2001 and therefore "mystery" is also there in the output.

The word "affliction" in the input title means pain or suffering therefore one of the possible genres can be "drama". When the movie that has the genre "drama" which is related to pain or suffering it is most likely that "thriller" can also be the genre of the movie.

input.title: a nightmare on elm street: the dream child

Positive Examples.explanation: The "nightmare" in input title most likely means that "horro" genre is one of the possible answers. The keyword "dream" in the input title can be strongly related to the genre "fantasy" therefore it is one of the answers in the output.

Negative Examples.explanation: The word "atomic" in the input title might relate to atom or atoms. Thus, "comedy" is not very likely to be the genre of the input movie title. This is not a completely wrong answer. It is partially correct. Apart from "sci-fi" another genre that makes a strong answer is "thriller".

The word "thrilling" in the output is an adjective and it cannot be the genre of the input title. Instead, one of the noun forms of "thrilling" which is "Thriller" should be one of the answers in the output list.

Word "heaven" in the output list is not a type of genre. Although "heaven" is the noun, it cannot be categorized as the movie genre. The word "paradise" in the input title might be related to genre "fantasy" but it cannot be "heaven" because the word "heaven" is not a genre.
